meanings.definition: A plant of the amaryllis family, having showy yellow or white flowers.
meanings.sent1: The garden was filled with colorful narcissus flowers.
meanings.sent2: I picked a bouquet of narcissus to brighten up the room.
meanings.sent3: The bees buzzed happily around the narcissus, enjoying their sweet nectar.
meanings.sent4: Her smile bloomed like a narcissus in the spring.
meanings.sent5: The delicate petals of the narcissus danced in the gentle breeze.

meanings.definition: A beautiful youth in Greek mythology who pines away for love of his own reflection and is then turned into the narcissus flower.
meanings.sent1: The story of Narcissus teaches us about the dangers of vanity.
meanings.sent2: Narcissus gazed at his reflection in the water, captivated by his own beauty.
meanings.sent3: In a humorous twist, Narcissus tried to take a selfie with his reflection.
meanings.sent4: Her obsession with perfection turned her into a modern-day Narcissus.
meanings.sent5: The mirror became Narcissus, trapping her in a cycle of self-adoration.
